Claim: The health insurance industry has “agreed to waive all co-payments for coronavirus treatments.”
Explaination: Health insurance companies said they will waive costs for coronavirus tests, not treatment. A shortage in diagnostic supplies means that testing is limited.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The health insurance industry has “agreed to waive all co-payments for coronavirus treatments.”

Explanation:Health insurance companies said they will waive costs for coronavirus tests, not treatment. A shortage in diagnostic supplies means that testing is limited.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/12/donald-trump/trump-wrongly-said-health-insurance-companies-will/

Claim: U.S. Vice President Pence urged people with coronavirus to go to the police.
Explaination: This is a fake Tweet by Pence. He never said this.
Label: False
html:
Claim: U.S. Vice President Pence urged people with coronavirus to go to the police.

Explanation:This is a fake Tweet by Pence. He never said this.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471803-Fact-Check-VP-Pence-Did-NOT-Urge-People-With-Coronavirus-To-Go-To-The-Police.html

Claim: Four people have died in Zanzibar after handling a chicken infected with COVID-19.
Explaination: A post claiming that four individuals in Zanzibar died from COVID-19 after handling a diseased chicken is false. The post contains images of a diseased chicken that circulated in other countries claiming to show symptoms of COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Four people have died in Zanzibar after handling a chicken infected with COVID-19.

Explanation:A post claiming that four individuals in Zanzibar died from COVID-19 after handling a diseased chicken is false. The post contains images of a diseased chicken that circulated in other countries claiming to show symptoms of COVID-19.

https://pesacheck.org/false-there-are-no-confirmed-cases-of-novel-coronavirus-in-zanzibar-2c8e23a6a02e

Claim: Taking a flu shot causes false positive results on COVID-19 tests.
Explaination: The 2012 study cited in this claim only tested for coronaviruses that cause the common cold, but not COVID-19, which was not discovered until 2019. Furthermore, only one of 69 individuals who had received the flu shot tested positive for coronavirus—a frequency that precludes drawing a causal association between the flu shot and coronavirus detection.
Label: Incorrect
html:
Claim: Taking a flu shot causes false positive results on COVID-19 tests.

Explanation:The 2012 study cited in this claim only tested for coronaviruses that cause the common cold, but not COVID-19, which was not discovered until 2019. Furthermore, only one of 69 individuals who had received the flu shot tested positive for coronavirus—a frequency that precludes drawing a causal association between the flu shot and coronavirus detection.

https://healthfeedback.org/claimreview/claim-that-flu-shot-causes-false-positive-results-on-covid-19-tests-is-unsupported-and-misleading/

Claim: Broiler chickens were found to have coronavirus in Mumbai.
Explaination: Chickens have not been identified as the source for the coronavirus so far and the attached pictures are not linked to coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Broiler chickens were found to have coronavirus in Mumbai.

Explanation:Chickens have not been identified as the source for the coronavirus so far and the attached pictures are not linked to coronavirus.

https://www.boomlive.in/health/false-coronavirus-found-in-broiler-chickens-6757

Claim: Bat market and bat meat are being sold in Wuhan.
Explaination: Video taken in Indonesia (Manado)
Label: False
html:
Claim: Bat market and bat meat are being sold in Wuhan.

Explanation:Video taken in Indonesia (Manado)

https://observers.france24.com/fr/20200130-intox-chine-soupe-chauve-souris-rumeur-origine-coronavirus?check=6

Claim: A video shows that after drinking snake blood during training in Thailand, US soldiers went to Wuhan for the Military World Games. The US soldiers were the intermediate hosts of COVID-19.
Explaination: The video was about the co-training event of the Cobra Gold exercise originally filmed by Reuters on March 4, 2020. However, the 7th Military World Games, which took place in Wuhan, happened in October 2019, prior to the training.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video shows that after drinking snake blood during training in Thailand, US soldiers went to Wuhan for the Military World Games. The US soldiers were the intermediate hosts of COVID-19.

Explanation:The video was about the co-training event of the Cobra Gold exercise originally filmed by Reuters on March 4, 2020. However, the 7th Military World Games, which took place in Wuhan, happened in October 2019, prior to the training.

https://tfc-taiwan.org.tw/articles/3580

Claim: Holding your breath for 10 seconds is a way to test for coronavirus.
Explaination: In a video, a woman showed how to supposedly test if one has coronavirus by holding her breath for ten seconds. WHO expert denied it.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Holding your breath for 10 seconds is a way to test for coronavirus.

Explanation:In a video, a woman showed how to supposedly test if one has coronavirus by holding her breath for ten seconds. WHO expert denied it.

https://elsurti.com/coronavirus-falso-respiracion/

Claim: The CDC now says that the coronavirus can survive on surfaces for up to 17 days.
Explaination: A CNBC story touted a misleading headline that said the CDC reported that the coronavirus survived on cruise ship cabins for up to 17 days. A recent CDC report found that traces of the virus were found on the ship for that long, not a live sample.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The CDC now says that the coronavirus can survive on surfaces for up to 17 days.

Explanation:A CNBC story touted a misleading headline that said the CDC reported that the coronavirus survived on cruise ship cabins for up to 17 days. A recent CDC report found that traces of the virus were found on the ship for that long, not a live sample.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/26/facebook-posts/theres-no-evidence-covid-19-can-survive-surfaces-1/

Claim: As per the news of Aajtak, Home Minister Amit Shah tested postive for COVID-19.
Explaination: Aajtak didn't telecast such news.
Label: False
html:
Claim: As per the news of Aajtak, Home Minister Amit Shah tested postive for COVID-19.

Explanation:Aajtak didn't telecast such news.

https://aajtak.intoday.in/story/fact-check-aajtak-never-shows-amit-shah-suffering-with-corona-virus-1-1175196.html

Claim: Scientists claim the Wuhan coronavirus is an HIV-1 engineered “super weapon.”
Explaination: The scientific research cited was not peer-reviewed, and the paper was withdrawn by the researchers to revise their results.There was also a note saying it was only a preliminary study.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Scientists claim the Wuhan coronavirus is an HIV-1 engineered “super weapon.”

Explanation:The scientific research cited was not peer-reviewed, and the paper was withdrawn by the researchers to revise their results.There was also a note saying it was only a preliminary study.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471581-fake-news-scientists-did-not-claim-wuhan-coronavirus-is-hiv-1-engineered-superweapon.html

Claim: Link takes viewers to application for FEMA assistance in the US.
Explaination: Link just takes you to a meme picture.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Link takes viewers to application for FEMA assistance in the US.

Explanation:Link just takes you to a meme picture.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3472016-fact-check-link-does-not-take-people-to-application-for-fema-assistance-and-no-1000-check.html

Claim: President Donald Trump tweeted, “I ordered the Treasury secretary to send checks to Americans! First however, we will go through your social media history from the last 4 years and search for any post with #NotMyPresident in it. I wouldn’t think of offending you with a check if I’m not your president! #MAGA”
Explaination: Americans could receive a $1,000 check as part of an economic stimulus package that isn't yet finalized. Donald Trump didn't tweet that he would vet who gets the checks based on whether they support him.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: President Donald Trump tweeted, “I ordered the Treasury secretary to send checks to Americans! First however, we will go through your social media history from the last 4 years and search for any post with #NotMyPresident in it. I wouldn’t think of offending you with a check if I’m not your president! #MAGA”

Explanation:Americans could receive a $1,000 check as part of an economic stimulus package that isn't yet finalized. Donald Trump didn't tweet that he would vet who gets the checks based on whether they support him.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/19/viral-image/no-trump-didnt-tweet-about-1000-checks/

Claim: An “open letter” purportedly written by US billionaire and philanthropist Bill Gates about the novel coronavirus pandemic has been shared in English and Chinese on Facebook, Twitter and various websites. The Chinese-language posts state the letter was translated from its original publication in British newspaper The Sun.
Explaination: But the letter is fake; Gates’ philanthropic organisation, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, clarified on Weibo that the letter presents “false information” and urged netizens to stop sharing it. The Sun has reportedly removed the letter from its website.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An “open letter” purportedly written by US billionaire and philanthropist Bill Gates about the novel coronavirus pandemic has been shared in English and Chinese on Facebook, Twitter and various websites. The Chinese-language posts state the letter was translated from its original publication in British newspaper The Sun.

Explanation:But the letter is fake; Gates’ philanthropic organisation, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, clarified on Weibo that the letter presents “false information” and urged netizens to stop sharing it. The Sun has reportedly removed the letter from its website.

https://factcheck.afp.com/gates-foundation-urges-netizens-stop-sharing-fake-bill-gates-coronavirus-letter

Claim: Tweet says Daniel Radcliffe has the coronavirus.
Explaination: A fake BBC Twitter account spread the claim before the tweet was removed and the account suspended from the platform.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: Tweet says Daniel Radcliffe has the coronavirus.

Explanation:A fake BBC Twitter account spread the claim before the tweet was removed and the account suspended from the platform.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/11/tweets/no-daniel-radcliffe-does-not-have-coronavirus/

Claim: The coronavirus pandemic can be dramatically slowed, or stopped, with the immediate widespread use of high doses of vitamin C.
Explaination: Maintaining an adequate intake of vitamin C is important for staying healthy. However, evidence from clinical trials shows that regular vitamin C supplementation does not prevent viral respiratory tract infections such as the common cold, which can be caused by coronaviruses, in the general population. Although some studies have shown a reduced incidence of the common cold in individuals undergoing severe physical stress, such as marathon runners.
Label: No evidence
html:
Claim: The coronavirus pandemic can be dramatically slowed, or stopped, with the immediate widespread use of high doses of vitamin C.

Explanation:Maintaining an adequate intake of vitamin C is important for staying healthy. However, evidence from clinical trials shows that regular vitamin C supplementation does not prevent viral respiratory tract infections such as the common cold, which can be caused by coronaviruses, in the general population. Although some studies have shown a reduced incidence of the common cold in individuals undergoing severe physical stress, such as marathon runners.

https://healthfeedback.org/claimreview/vitamin-c-supplementation-does-not-prevent-viral-respiratory-infections-such-as-those-caused-by-coronaviruses-in-the-general-population/?check=1

Claim: Turmeric and lemon can cure the coronavirus.
Explaination: Medical practitioners and even WHO has rubbished this claim and has said that there is no evidence to prove that turmeric and lemon can be used to cure coronavirus.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Turmeric and lemon can cure the coronavirus.

Explanation:Medical practitioners and even WHO has rubbished this claim and has said that there is no evidence to prove that turmeric and lemon can be used to cure coronavirus.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/turmeric-and-lemon-help-fight-coronavirus-heres-the-truth-fake-news-doctors-explain

Claim: Does Mexico have confirmed cases of COVID-19?
Explaination: Johns Hopkins coronavirus Resource Center has records showing Mexico has COVID-19 cases.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Does Mexico have confirmed cases of COVID-19?

Explanation:Johns Hopkins coronavirus Resource Center has records showing Mexico has COVID-19 cases.

https://leadstories.com/cgi-bin/mt/mt-search.cgi?search=coronavirus&IncludeBlogs=1&blog_id=1&limit=10&page=6

Claim: There is a “positive” case of the novel coronavirus (nCoV) in a hospital in Banlic, Cabuyao City, Laguna, Philippines in January 2020.
Explaination: There was no coronavirus case at the Global Medical Center of Laguna around the time the claim was spread.
Label: False
html:
Claim: There is a “positive” case of the novel coronavirus (nCoV) in a hospital in Banlic, Cabuyao City, Laguna, Philippines in January 2020.

Explanation:There was no coronavirus case at the Global Medical Center of Laguna around the time the claim was spread.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/250677-positive-coronavirus-case-hospital-laguna

Claim: LGBTQ people in the US are demanding to be treated first for coronavirus.
Explaination: Pulpit and Pen quotes a Reuters article about an open letter signed by more than 100 LGBTQ rights groups, calling on organisations handling the global coronavirus pandemic to remember “that LGBTQ+ communities are among those who are particularly vulnerable to the negative health effects of this virus”. But it doesn't ask for anyone to be given priority treatment.
Label: False
html:
Claim: LGBTQ people in the US are demanding to be treated first for coronavirus.

Explanation:Pulpit and Pen quotes a Reuters article about an open letter signed by more than 100 LGBTQ rights groups, calling on organisations handling the global coronavirus pandemic to remember “that LGBTQ+ communities are among those who are particularly vulnerable to the negative health effects of this virus”. But it doesn't ask for anyone to be given priority treatment.

https://africacheck.org/fbcheck/no-lgbtq-people-in-us-havent-demanded-first-treatment-for-covid-19/

Claim: Video of Canadian PM Justin Trudeau’s wife who is suffering from COVID-19.
Explaination: Woman seen in the video is not the wife of Justin Trudeau but a COVID-19 patient from London.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Video of Canadian PM Justin Trudeau’s wife who is suffering from COVID-19.

Explanation:Woman seen in the video is not the wife of Justin Trudeau but a COVID-19 patient from London.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-no-this-covid-19-patient-is-not-the-wife-of-canadian-pm-justin-trudeau-1658145-2020-03-21

Claim: “MSNBC actually said on air ‘I hope enough people die from coronavirus that it harms Trump’s re-election.’”
Explaination: MSNBC panelists compared former President George W. Bush’s response to Hurricane Katrina to President Donald Trump’s response to the coronavirus outbreak, and speculated it could hurt his popularity.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “MSNBC actually said on air ‘I hope enough people die from coronavirus that it harms Trump’s re-election.’”

Explanation:MSNBC panelists compared former President George W. Bush’s response to Hurricane Katrina to President Donald Trump’s response to the coronavirus outbreak, and speculated it could hurt his popularity.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/18/facebook-posts/no-msnbc-didnt-say-it-hopes-coronavirus-kills-enou/

Claim: Inhaling the steam from boiled water with dissolved salt is an effective cure for COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: As of Tuesday, March 31, there is still no cure approved to treat the novel coronavirus, but there are treatments approved by the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) that may help ease the symptoms. Inhaling salt water steam is not among them.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Inhaling the steam from boiled water with dissolved salt is an effective cure for COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:As of Tuesday, March 31, there is still no cure approved to treat the novel coronavirus, but there are treatments approved by the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) that may help ease the symptoms. Inhaling salt water steam is not among them.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/256475-salt-water-steam-cure-coronavirus

Explaination: An article by Times Live claiming that 14 students from the University of Nairobi are infected with coronavirus cites a non-existent news story by KTN News.

Claim: 14 University of Nairobi students have tested positive for COVID-19.

Explanation:An article by Times Live claiming that 14 students from the University of Nairobi are infected with coronavirus cites a non-existent news story by KTN News.

https://pesacheck.org/false-a-post-claiming-that-14-university-of-nairobi-students-are-infected-with-covid-19-is-a-hoax-7a0ddd3be2a8?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Explaination: PIB India clarified that this viral message is Fake. According to WHO there is no cure medicine discovered or recommended to cure coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Bitter gourd juice can cure coronavirus in just two hours.

Explanation:PIB India clarified that this viral message is Fake. According to WHO there is no cure medicine discovered or recommended to cure coronavirus.
